Well I don't know much about anything, but I sure liked this film. In short, it was creative, humorous, simple, and heartwarming. Okay, since that's all you need to know, I won't go on and on and on about it. Suffice to say that I stood and clapped at the end. This was a very well-done indie with catchy, original graphics and great character interaction. Go see it!

A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat. The film, based on Stephenie Meyer’s novel, also stars Fred Weller, Dominik Minico, and Lena Olin.
